html: Coby Mach was a dear friend who contributed so much to the community of Lincoln and the state of Nebraska. Bruce and I were shocked and brokenhearted to hear of his tragic passing. Our sincerest condolences and prayers are with Coby’s wife, Lorie, and his daughters Sara & Annie.
text: Coby Mach was a dear friend who contributed so much to the community of Lincoln and the state of Nebraska. Bruce and I were shocked and brokenhearted to hear of his tragic passing. Our sincerest condolences and prayers are with Coby’s wife, Lorie, and his daughters Sara & Annie.

html: Today Senator @MarkWarner and I introduced the bipartisan Deceptive Experiences To Online Users Reduction or DETOUR Act to curb the use of “dark patterns” & increase trust online. Read more here: https://www.fischer.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/news?ID=5682EB5E-9331-49FA-BFD1-186A155DB4D5 …
text: Today Senator @MarkWarner and I introduced the bipartisan Deceptive Experiences To Online Users Reduction or DETOUR Act  to curb the use of “dark patterns” & increase trust online. Read more here: https://www.fischer.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/news?ID=5682EB5E-9331-49FA-BFD1-186A155DB4D5 …

html: “Dark Patterns” are manipulative user interfaces that intentionally limit understanding & undermine consumer choice. Misleading prompts to just click the OK button can often transfer your contacts, messages, browsing activity, photos, or location info w/out you even realizing it.
text: “Dark Patterns” are manipulative user interfaces that intentionally limit understanding & undermine consumer choice. Misleading prompts to just click the OK button can often transfer your contacts, messages, browsing activity, photos, or location info w/out you even realizing it.

html: Pleased to see @SenateCommerce unanimously pass the TRACED Act out of committee today. I am a cosponsor of this #bipartisan bill that would boost @FCC's ability to crack down on illegal and unwanted robocalls and penalize bad actors who overwhelm consumers with calls.
text: Pleased to see @SenateCommerce unanimously pass the TRACED Act out of committee today. I am a cosponsor of this #bipartisan bill that would boost @FCC's ability to crack down on illegal and unwanted robocalls and penalize bad actors who overwhelm consumers with calls.

html: I am honored to tell Cory’s story and join Nebraskans and Americans across our county in saluting Cory’s willingness to serve.
text: I am honored to tell Cory’s story and join Nebraskans and Americans across our county in saluting Cory’s willingness to serve.

html: Today, if you go to Chadron, Nebraska you will see the Sergeant Cory Mracek Memorial Post Office. I was proud to work w/ former NE Senator Mike Johanns on a bill renaming this post office in honor Cory.
text: Today, if you go to Chadron, Nebraska you will see the Sergeant Cory Mracek Memorial Post Office. I was proud to work w/ former NE Senator Mike Johanns on a bill renaming this post office in honor Cory.

html: Communities came together to line the streets as his funeral procession went through their town as it made its 46-mile journey across Nebraska.
text: Communities came together to line the streets as his funeral procession went through their town as it made its 46-mile journey across Nebraska.

html: A week later 600 family members, friends, and military officials gathered inside a Nebraska gymnasium to celebrate and honor Cory and his sacrifice for our country.
text: A week later 600 family members, friends, and military officials gathered inside a Nebraska gymnasium to celebrate and honor Cory and his sacrifice for our country.

html: Cory and two other U.S. service members were killed by the explosion. #NEhero
text: Cory and two other U.S. service members were killed by the explosion. #NEhero

html: On January 27, 2004, his mother remembers spending the morning instant messaging with Cory to catch up and see how he was doing. Later that same day, Cory and his reconnaissance platoon were performing a mission where they came across an IED.
text: On January 27, 2004, his mother remembers spending the morning instant messaging with Cory to catch up and see how he was doing. Later that same day, Cory and his reconnaissance platoon were performing a mission where they came across an IED.

html: After a couple of years in active duty, he was deployed to #Iraq to an area that saw major combat activity and sectarian violence during 2003-2007.
text: After a couple of years in active duty, he was deployed to #Iraq to an area that saw major combat activity and sectarian violence during 2003-2007.

html: He came back home in 2001 and transitioned back to the @NENationalGuard. However, when 9/11 happened, Cory told his parents that he was going to go back to the Active Army so he could serve his country. #Service
text: He came back home in 2001 and transitioned back to the @NENationalGuard. However, when 9/11 happened, Cory told his parents that he was going to go back to the Active Army so he could serve his country. #Service

html: A year later, Cory transferred to the Active Army & was soon deployed to South Korea. He enjoyed his time there and he even participated in the #ManchuaMile where he marched for 24-miles in full combat gear.
text: A year later, Cory transferred to the Active Army & was soon deployed to South Korea. He enjoyed his time there and he even participated in the #ManchuaMile where he marched for 24-miles in full combat gear.

html: After graduating high school, he went on to attend college at @Chadronstate. While in college he decided to join the @NENationalGuard and left to go train at Fort Sill, Oklahoma. #NEhero
text: After graduating high school, he went on to attend college at @Chadronstate. While in college he decided to join the @NENationalGuard and left to go train at Fort Sill, Oklahoma. #NEhero

html: During high school, he became involved in many extracurricular activities and played basketball and football.
text: During high school, he became involved in many extracurricular activities and played basketball and football.

html: Born in Chadron, Nebraska, Cory Mracek was always trying to have a good time. He was often found either laughing or trying to make others laugh.
text: Born in Chadron, Nebraska, Cory Mracek was always trying to have a good time. He was often found either laughing or trying to make others laugh.

html: The EPA gave "hardship exemptions" to profitable refineries, releasing them from their biofuel blending obligations. According to projections, this could cause the ethanol industry to lose billions of gallons in demand.
text: The EPA gave "hardship exemptions" to profitable refineries, releasing them from their biofuel blending obligations. According to projections, this could cause the ethanol industry to lose billions of gallons in demand.

html: Sen. Deb Fischer slams Rep. Adam Smith for questioning the need for ICBMs: “To casually assert that an entire leg of the triad is superfluous disregards the best advice of our military leadership and the threat assessments we’ve received. It is a dangerous, misguided assertion."
text: Sen. Deb Fischer slams Rep. Adam Smith for questioning the need for ICBMs: “To casually assert that an entire leg of the triad is superfluous disregards the best advice of our military leadership and the threat assessments we’ve received. It is a dangerous, misguided assertion."

html: Both the Obama and @realdonaldtrump administrations agree on the value of the triad, as has every administration since the Eisenhower-era. The testimony from our senior military leaders has also been clear and consistent: Our nuclear triad is necessary to keep our nation safe.
text: Both the Obama and @realdonaldtrump administrations agree on the value of the triad, as has every administration since the Eisenhower-era. The testimony from our senior military leaders has also been clear and consistent: Our nuclear triad is necessary to keep our nation safe.

html: Today @HASCDemocrats Chair @RepAdamSmith said he doesn’t think ICBMs are necessary for nuclear deterrence. To casually assert that an entire leg of the triad is superfluous disregards the best advice of our military leadership. It is a dangerous, misguided assertion.
text: Today @HASCDemocrats Chair @RepAdamSmith said he doesn’t think ICBMs are necessary for nuclear deterrence. To casually assert that an entire leg of the triad is superfluous disregards the best advice of our military leadership. It is a dangerous, misguided assertion.

html: As our nuclear deterrent becomes more important to our nation’s defense, the need for nuclear modernization only grows. This conclusion is echoed by the administration’s #NuclearPostureReview.

html: The #FarmBill is now law. Today is a great day for NE's farmers, ranchers & rural communities. This bipartisan bill gives our producers a critical safety net, enhances our nation’s trade promotion programs, and helps deliver #broadband to farm country.

html: I join Nebraskans and Americans across our country in saluting Matt’s bravery and #sacrifice. It is an honor to tell his story. #NEhero
text: I join Nebraskans and Americans across our country in saluting Matt’s bravery and #sacrifice. It is an honor to tell his story. #NEhero

html: Matt was a consistent source of inspiration for his fellow Marines, he was the kind of young man that people were just drawn to. He was tough yet a selfless Marine. #SemperFi
text: Matt was a consistent source of inspiration for his fellow Marines, he was the kind of young man that people were just drawn to. He was tough yet a selfless Marine. #SemperFi

html: For his ultimate sacrifice, Corporal Matt Henderson received the naval achievement medal with cluster, a Purple Heart, and he was the first to receive the prestigious Non-Commissioned Officer Combat Engineer of the Year award posthumously.
text: For his ultimate sacrifice, Corporal Matt Henderson received the naval achievement medal with cluster, a Purple Heart, and he was the first to receive the prestigious Non-Commissioned Officer Combat Engineer of the Year award posthumously.

html: Matt warned his squad to get back and take cover but was unable to get out of range himself. The remainder of his squad survived. #Leadership #Service #Sacrifice
text: Matt warned his squad to get back and take cover but was unable to get out of range himself. The remainder of his squad survived. #Leadership #Service #Sacrifice

html: As a squad leader, Matt was aware of and concerned about the dangers of his second deployment. On May 26, 2004, Matt was leading his squad in sweeping an area in the Al Anbar province of Iraq. During the sweep, Matt and two of his men were killed when an IED was detonated #NEhero
text: As a squad leader, Matt was aware of and concerned about the dangers of his second deployment. On May 26, 2004, Matt was leading his squad in sweeping an area in the Al Anbar province of Iraq. During the sweep, Matt and two of his men were killed when an IED was detonated #NEhero

html: In February of 2004, Matt deployed to Iraq for the second time and Jaimie moved back to #Nebraska to be closer to their families.
text: In February of 2004, Matt deployed to Iraq for the second time and Jaimie moved back to #Nebraska to be closer to their families.

html: Upon Matt’s return home in May of 2003, he and Jaimie finally had their big church wedding in Lincoln, NE. They moved to California where Matt was stationed.
text: Upon Matt’s return home in May of 2003, he and Jaimie finally had their big church wedding in Lincoln, NE. They moved to California where Matt was stationed.

html: During his deployment, Matt was chosen to be a squad leader due to his #leadership abilities & the respect of the other Marines. Matt’s family had no communication with him during this time and watched the news every evening with the hopes of catching a glimpse of Matt.
text: During his deployment, Matt was chosen to be a squad leader due to his #leadership abilities & the respect of the other Marines. Matt’s family had no communication with him during this time and watched the news every evening with the hopes of catching a glimpse of Matt.

html: In February of 2003, Matt deployed to Iraq where he joined other U.S. led forces in the invasion of Iraq from Kuwait in order to oust Saddam Hussein. #NEhero
text: In February of 2003, Matt deployed to Iraq where he joined other U.S. led forces in the invasion of Iraq from Kuwait in order to oust Saddam Hussein. #NEhero

html: On August 4, 2001, Matt proposed to his girlfriend Jaimie on Mission Beach in San Diego just after sunset. As they planned their wedding in Nebraska, Matt’s unit was informed they would be among the first forces to invade Iraq.
text: On August 4, 2001, Matt proposed to his girlfriend Jaimie on Mission Beach in San Diego just after sunset. As they planned their wedding in Nebraska, Matt’s unit was informed they would be among the first forces to invade Iraq.

html: Due to his strong interest in the construction field, Matt also finished Combat Engineer School at Camp Lejeune, and he was assigned to the 1st Combat Engineers Battalion at Camp Pendleton.
text: Due to his strong interest in the construction field, Matt also finished Combat Engineer School at Camp Lejeune, and he was assigned to the 1st Combat Engineers Battalion at Camp Pendleton.

html: In 2000, Matt joined the @USMC because he was attracted to the discipline & direction it offered. He completed boot camp at @MCRD_SD before attending & completing infantry training at @MCIWPendletonCA. #Service
text: In 2000, Matt joined the @USMC because he was attracted to the discipline & direction it offered. He completed boot camp at @MCRD_SD before attending & completing infantry training at @MCIWPendletonCA. #Service

html: Matt loved sports and was a devout @Huskers and @ChicagoBears fan. #GBR #Tradition
text: Matt loved sports and was a devout @Huskers and @ChicagoBears fan. #GBR #Tradition

html: After Matt’s father finished veterinary school, he moved the family to the Good Life. As Matt grew up, he made many friends and could be found by his dad’s side on equine veterinary visits.
text: After Matt’s father finished veterinary school, he moved the family to the Good Life. As Matt grew up, he made many friends and could be found by his dad’s side on equine veterinary visits.

html: From the beginning, I have supported Judge Kavanaugh because he is eminently qualified to serve on SCOTUS. I reviewed the FBI report and there continues to be no corroboration or evidence that he was involved in any misconduct. I look forward to voting for him later this week.
text: From the beginning, I have supported Judge Kavanaugh because he is eminently qualified to serve on SCOTUS. I reviewed the FBI report and there continues to be no corroboration or evidence that he was involved in any misconduct. I look forward to voting for him later this week.

html: Our bill would extend the tax credit to give businesses more time to implement a program, expand #PaidFamilyLeave for employees, and allow lawmakers to access sufficient data to assess the effectiveness of the program. Read the bill here : https://goo.gl/KrgpNG
text: Our bill would extend the tax credit to give businesses more time to implement a program, expand #PaidFamilyLeave for employees, and allow lawmakers to access sufficient data to assess the effectiveness of the program. Read the bill here : https://goo.gl/KrgpNG

html: Because the guidance on using the credit was not issued until today @SenAngusKing @SenDeanHeller and I have introduced new legislation: The #PaidFamilyLeavePilotExtensionAct.
text: Because the guidance on using the credit was not issued until today @SenAngusKing @SenDeanHeller and I have introduced new legislation: The #PaidFamilyLeavePilotExtensionAct.

html: Under current law, the program is a two-year tax credit. This was intended to give Congress the opportunity to determine its effectiveness.
text: Under current law, the program is a two-year tax credit. This was intended to give Congress the opportunity to determine its effectiveness.

html: The policy is targeted to hourly employees who would not otherwise have access to #PaidFamilyLeave. Employees who participate cannot make more than $72,000 per year.pic.twitter.com/bUuuhOuX09
text: The policy is targeted to hourly employees who would not otherwise have access to #PaidFamilyLeave. Employees who participate cannot make more than $72,000 per year.pic.twitter.com/bUuuhOuX09

html: In exchange for offering #PaidFamilyLeave, employers will receive as much as a 25% tax credit for the amount of wages replaced. #StrongFamiliesActpic.twitter.com/cJJBXzuEqu
text: In exchange for offering #PaidFamilyLeave, employers will receive as much as a 25% tax credit for the amount of wages replaced. #StrongFamiliesActpic.twitter.com/cJJBXzuEqu

html: Through this historic and voluntary program, employers can offer up to 12 weeks of #PaidFamilyLeave. The leave can be used to take care of a family member or utilized for maternity or paternity leave with biological or adopted children.pic.twitter.com/Q8Hq0zup95
text: Through this historic and voluntary program, employers can offer up to 12 weeks of #PaidFamilyLeave. The leave can be used to take care of a family member or utilized for maternity or paternity leave with biological or adopted children.pic.twitter.com/Q8Hq0zup95

html: Sergeant First Class Tricia Jameson loved her family, she embodied the pride of her state and the values of our nation. #NEHeroes #Service
text: Sergeant First Class Tricia Jameson loved her family, she embodied the pride of her state and the values of our nation. #NEHeroes #Service

html: For her service to our nation, Sergeant First Class Tricia Jameson earned many military decorations, including the Purple Heart and Bronze Star posthumously. #NEHeroes #Service
text: For her service to our nation, Sergeant First Class Tricia Jameson earned many military decorations, including the Purple Heart and Bronze Star posthumously. #NEHeroes #Service

html: Sgt. Jameson’s name and reputation live on as soldiers save lives, just as she did, on the battlefield.
text: Sgt. Jameson’s name and reputation live on as soldiers save lives, just as she did, on the battlefield.

html: Without hesitation, Sgt. Jameson answered the call. She was speeding towards the battlefield to attend to the fallen when her field ambulance was struck by an IED. That day, she gave her life while serving her country.
text: Without hesitation, Sgt. Jameson answered the call. She was speeding towards the battlefield to attend to the fallen when her field ambulance was struck by an IED. That day, she gave her life while serving her country.

html: Sgt. Jameson and her battle buddy, Specialist Rachelle Spors received an urgent call to help injured Marines in combat a few miles from where they were.
text: Sgt. Jameson and her battle buddy, Specialist Rachelle Spors received an urgent call to help injured Marines in combat a few miles from where they were.

html: By June of 2005, Sgt. Jameson was in Iraq on duty with the 313th Medical Company at Camp Speicher. Jameson’s first mission on the road was a long one. She was the vehicle commander of an M997 ambulance that was headed to Trebil near the Jordan border.
text: By June of 2005, Sgt. Jameson was in Iraq on duty with the 313th Medical Company at Camp Speicher. Jameson’s first mission on the road was a long one. She was the vehicle commander of an M997 ambulance that was headed to Trebil near the Jordan border.

html: With her determination, she raised that program into a world-class operation. The soldiers who took her program went on to save lives around the world.
text: With her determination, she raised that program into a world-class operation. The soldiers who took her program went on to save lives around the world.

html: As combat intensified in #Afghanistan and #Iraq, Tricia was tasked with improving the Combat Life Saver course, which teaches soldiers basic medical skills for the battlefield.
text: As combat intensified in #Afghanistan and #Iraq, Tricia was tasked with improving the Combat Life Saver course, which teaches soldiers basic medical skills for the battlefield.

html: After high school, Tricia joined the @NENationalGuard in 1994. With her grit and determination, she soon was promoted to become a full-time training instructor at Camp Ashland.
text: After high school, Tricia joined the @NENationalGuard in 1994. With her grit and determination, she soon was promoted to become a full-time training instructor at Camp Ashland.

html: Tricia grew up in the farm country of St. Paul, NE, and at a young age, she advocated for what is right and how others should be treated.
text: Tricia grew up in the farm country of St. Paul, NE, and at a young age, she advocated for what is right and how others should be treated.
